projects.title: AIDS Affected Children - South Africa
projects.summary: Franciscan Sisters are looking after 75 AIDS affected children in Kwazulu-Natal, South Africa.
projects.description: Sr Margaret McDermott writes that: "your funds enabled us to continue feeding and caring for these vulnerable children who have lost their parents to AIDS."

projects.title: Digging Wells - India
projects.summary: Many people in developing countries do not have access to safe, fresh water. Digging wells for communities is an important part of our work, particularly in drought-prone areas.
projects.description: Many people in developing countries do not have access to safe, fresh water. Digging wells for communities is an important part of our work, particularly in drought-prone areas. Access to clean water transforms communities, reducing disease and freeing up time for education and work.

projects.title: Drought and Food Shortage - Tanzania
projects.summary: Drought due to unreliable rainfall is a constantly recurring problem in Tanzania. When the rains don't come, the crops wither and die.
projects.description: Drought due to unreliable rainfall is a constantly recurring problem in Tanzania. When the rains don't come, the crops wither and die. We provide emergency food relief and support to help communities survive these challenging times.

projects.title: Feeding Programme and Dispensary - Congo
projects.summary: Fr. Andrew Lukhale, a Consolata Father in the Congo, writes about the critical need for medical support.
projects.description: Fr. Andrew Lukhale, a Consolata Father in the Congo, writes: "We have only one nurse attending to more than 10,000 people and I am grateful for the help you gave." Your donations help fund essential medical supplies and support for overworked healthcare workers in remote areas.

projects.title: Homes for Poor - Vietnam
projects.summary: No family can flourish without a proper home, yet millions live in shanty towns, or makeshift huts made of cardboard boxes and plastic sheeting. Many people are homeless.
projects.description: No family can flourish without a proper home, yet millions live in shanty towns, or makeshift huts made of cardboard boxes and plastic sheeting. Many people are homeless. We fund the construction of simple but dignified homes for families in desperate need, giving them security and a foundation for a better future.
